communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background: 

At some point near the end of 2024, NARA published a report titled "2024 Update for Reparative Description" at <https://www.archives.gov/research/reparative-description/update-2024>.  (This page has since been removed.) The update states NARA "moved reparative description work from a temporary working group to incorporating reparative description into the regular description processes of the agency". The page makes reference to various processes and training materials, for which it is reasonable to assume there will be records. Specifically, NARA wrote:

1. "We are incorporating reparative description training into the regular agency-wide training program for the staff who work on description."
2. "We developed and implemented processes for terms to be identified and recommendations for updating to be submitted by staff or the public for consideration."
3. "We developed the process for our standards board to review submissions and provide final recommendations for the Archivist."

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of any "reparative description training" materials referenced at the above web page. If they are embedded within a larger web page, document, PDF, slide deck, or video, the entire training document is requested. This request for the version of the materials which is being referenced at the time of the publication of the undated Update above. If it cannot be determined anymore what the publication date is, December 31, 2024.

2. A copy of the agency policy, guidelines, memo, or other documents which were referred to when NARA described that it had developed "processes for terms to be identified and recommendations for updating".

3.  A copy of the agency policy, guidelines, memo, or other documents which were referred to when NARA described that it had developed "the process for our standards board to review submissions and provide final recommendations"

4. Copies of any such recommendations made to the Archivist by the NARA Lifecycle Data Standards Board under the above cited process, both approved and rejected (if any). Or if they were tracked in a spreadsheet or similar single document with information about the recommendations and the Archivist's responses, this is preferable to conducting a search of emails.

5. As pertains to the process(es) outlined in request #2 & #3 above, I also request a copy of the CURRENT authorized version of the operative agency policy, if it has changed since it was described in the statement in the 2024 Update. Or, if it was rescinded, any memo or record indicating such.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of any charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Darren Barton-McDougall

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I am hereby requesting access to the records listed below and held by the Prince George's County Police Department:

- Copies of any and all internal affairs complaints, including internal, citizen, or other agency complaints for Officer Ivan Mendez (3508).
- Complete investigative files for each complaint, including but not limited to reports of recorded statements, video surveillance or body camera footage, investigative files, witness interviews, and photographs.  
- The investigative findings of each complaint.
- Any correspondence from the Civilian Review Board, Police Advisory Commission or other civilian police oversight board.
- The final disposition of each case, if any.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.  Alternatively, please consider waiving any fees, pursuant to § 4-206(e)(2)(ii) of the General Provisions Article, as this request is on behalf of individuals served by the Maryland Office of the Public Defender, a state government agency, which solely serves indigent citizens of Maryland.  As a result, my request for the above-listed public records is in the public interest.  I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Deborah Levi
Director of Special Litigation
Maryland Office of the Public Defender
(443) 272-1068

title: Library Contract Request: LexisNexis at Virginia State University

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Library Contract Request: LexisNexis at Virginia State University
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with LexisNexis, relating to the licensing of the academic research product LexisNexis Academic (a.k.a. NexisUni); and
All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the academic research product LexisNexis Academic (a.k.a. NexisUni).
Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of the academic research product LexisNexis Academic (a.k.a. NexisUni).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with mo.
